Homework project documentation¶

Add your content using reStructuredText syntax. See the reStructuredText documentation for details.

REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Checks the health of the application by verifying the database connection.

This endpoint executes a simple query (SELECT 1) to check the health of the database. If the database is properly configured, it returns a success message. Otherwise, it raises an HTTP exception.

Parameters:

db (AsyncSession) – The database session that is used for the health check.

Returns:

A health check message if the database is configured correctly.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the database is not properly configured or an error occurs during the check.

main.index()¶

Returns a simple message indicating the application’s success.

Returns:

A dictionary with a message confirming the app is running. :rtype: dict

async main.startup()¶

Initializes Redis and FastAPI limiter during the startup of the application.

This function is called when the FastAPI app starts. It establishes a connection to the Redis server, sets up FastAPILimiter, and makes sure that the limiter is ready to use for limiting the number of requests. :raises ConnectionError: If the Redis server is not accessible or fails to connect. :raises SQLAlchemyError: If an error occurs while initializing the database.

REST API repository REPOSITORY¶

async src.repository.repository.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

Marks a user’s email as confirmed in the database.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user to confirm.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

async src.repository.repository.delete_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: AsyncSession)¶

Removes a contact for a user based on the contact ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • user (User) – The user who owns the contact.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

The removed contact object if successful, otherwise None.

Return type:

Optional[Contact]

Raises:

Logs an error if an exception occurs during the database operation.

async src.repository.repository.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: AsyncSession)¶

Retrieves a contact for a user by its ID.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user requesting the contact.

Returns:

The contact object if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

Optional[Contact]

Raises:

Logs an error if an exception occurs during the database operation.

async src.repository.repository.get_contacts(db: AsyncSession, user_id: int, limit: int = 10, offset: int = 0)¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with optional pagination.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • user_id (int) – The ID of the user whose contacts are to be retrieved.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to retrieve. Defaults to 10.

  • offset (int) – The number of contacts to skip before retrieving. Defaults to 0.

Returns:

A list of contacts belonging to the specified user.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.repository.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

Retrieves a user from the database by their email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user to retrieve.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

The user object if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.repository.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

Updates the avatar URL for a user based on their email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user whose avatar URL needs to be updated.

  • url (str | None) – The new avatar URL to be set, or None to clear the avatar.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user object.

Return type:

User

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user with the given email is not found.

async src.repository.repository.update_contact(contact_id: int, contact: ContactCreate, user: User, db: AsyncSession)¶

Updates an existing contact for a user with new data.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact (ContactCreate) – The new contact data to update.

  • user (User) – The user who owns the contact.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact object if successful, otherwise None.

Return type:

Optional[Contact]

Raises:

Logs an error if an exception occurs during the database operation.

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirms the user’s email address via a token.

This endpoint allows the user to confirm their email address by providing a verification token. If the user has already confirmed their email, a message is returned indicating that the email is already confirmed.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The email confirmation token.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

A confirmation message.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user is not found or if verification fails.

async src.routes.auth.login(form_data: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Logs in a user and provides access and refresh tokens.

This endpoint authenticates the user by verifying the email and password. If successful, it returns an access token and a refresh token. If the email is not confirmed, it raises an error.

Parameters:

  • form_data (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The user’s login credentials (email and password).

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

A dictionary with the access token, refresh token, and token type.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the email or password is incorrect, or if the email is not confirmed.

async src.routes.auth.register(user_data: UserCreate, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Registers a new user and sends a confirmation email.

This endpoint allows users to register with their email, username, and password. After the user is created, an email with a confirmation token is sent, and the user receives access and refresh tokens.

Parameters:

  • user_data (UserCreate) – The user registration data (email, username, and password).

  • bt (BackgroundTasks) – The background task to send the confirmation email.

  • request (Request) – The incoming HTTP request used to construct the base URL for email confirmation.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

A JSON response with the access token, refresh token, and user information.

Return type:

JSONResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the email is already registered or an internal error occurs during registration.

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Requests an email confirmation for a user.

This endpoint sends an email confirmation request to the user. If the email is already confirmed, a message indicating that is returned. If the user is found but the email is not confirmed, a confirmation email is sent.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – The request email data (user’s email address).

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks for sending the email.

  • request (Request) – The incoming HTTP request used to construct the base URL for email confirmation.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

A message indicating the status of the confirmation email.

Return type:

dict

REST API routes Routes¶

async src.routes.routes.create_contact(contact_data: ContactCreate, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Creates a new contact for the currently authenticated user.

This endpoint allows the user to create a new contact by providing contact details. The contact is associated with the authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • contact_data (ContactCreate) – The contact details (name, email, phone, etc.) to be added.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact creation fails or the user is unauthorized.

async src.routes.routes.delete_contact_(contact_id: int, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Deletes a contact for the currently authenticated user.

This endpoint deletes a contact identified by its ID, provided it belongs to the authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

A 204 No Content status code on successful deletion.

Return type:

None

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found or the user is unauthorized.

async src.routes.routes.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: AsyncSession)¶

Retrieves a specific contact by its ID for the currently authenticated user.

This function checks if the contact exists and belongs to the currently authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

The contact if found and belongs to the user, otherwise None.

Return type:

Optional[Contact]

Raises:

Logs an error if the contact retrieval fails.

async src.routes.routes.get_upcoming_birthdays(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieves contacts with upcoming birthdays within the next 7 days for the currently authenticated user.

This endpoint returns contacts that have birthdays coming up within the next 7 days, based on the current date. The user must be authenticated.

Parameters:

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthdays within the next 7 days.

Return type:

list[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.routes.read_contact(contact_id: int, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieves a specific contact by its ID for the currently authenticated user.

This endpoint returns details of a specific contact associated with the authenticated user. If the contact is not found or does not belong to the user, a 404 error is returned.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

The requested contact details.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found or does not belong to the user.

async src.routes.routes.read_contacts(limit: int = 10, offset: int = 0, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for the currently authenticated user.

This endpoint returns the user’s contacts with pagination support. The user can specify the number of contacts to return (limit) and the starting point (offset).

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – The number of contacts to retrieve (default is 10).

  • offset (int) – The offset from which to start retrieving contacts (default is 0).

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of the user’s contacts.

Return type:

list[ContactResponse]

Raises:

HTTPException – If there is an issue with retrieving the contacts.

async src.routes.routes.search_contacts(first_name: str | None = Query(None), last_name: str | None = Query(None), email: str | None = Query(None), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Searches for contacts based on optional filters (first name, last name, or email).

This endpoint allows the user to search for contacts that match the provided filters (first name, last name, or email). All contacts belong to the authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • first_name (Optional[str]) – The first name of the contact to search for (optional).

  • last_name (Optional[str]) – The last name of the contact to search for (optional).

  • email (Optional[str]) – The email address of the contact to search for (optional).

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search criteria.

Return type:

list[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.routes.update_contact_(contact_id: int, contact: ContactCreate, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Updates an existing contact for the currently authenticated user.

This endpoint allows the user to update an existing contact’s details. The contact is identified by its ID and updated with the new data provided. The contact must belong to the authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact (ContactCreate) – The new contact details.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found or the user is unauthorized.

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.update_avatar(file: UploadFile, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Updates the user’s avatar.

This function takes an image file, uploads it to a cloud storage service (e.g., Cloudinary), and updates the avatar URL in the database for the currently authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The image file to upload.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

A response message indicating the avatar has been updated successfully, along with the new avatar URL.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If an error occurs (e.g., if the user is not found or there is an issue with the file upload).

REST API service Auth¶

src.utils.auth.hash_password(password: str) → str¶

Hashes the given password using a secure hashing algorithm.

This function takes a plain password as input and returns a hashed version of the password using the configured password hashing context.

Parameters:

password (str) – The plain password to be hashed.

Returns:

The hashed password.

Return type:

str

Raises:

ValueError – If the password is empty or invalid.

src.utils.auth.verify_password(plain_password: str, hashed_password: str) → bool¶

Verifies that a plain password matches a hashed password.

This function compares the plain password with the hashed password and returns a boolean indicating whether the two passwords match.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain password to verify.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password to compare against.

Returns:

True if the passwords match, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Raises:

ValueError – If either of the passwords is empty or invalid.

REST API service Email¶

async src.utils.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Sends an email to the user for email verification with a verification token.

This function generates a token for email verification using the provided email address, creates an email message with a confirmation link, and sends the email using the configured email service.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The email address of the user to whom the verification email will be sent.

  • username (str) – The username of the user to include in the verification email message.

  • host (str) – The host URL used to generate the verification link.

Returns:

None

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If an error occurs while trying to send the email, such as a connection failure.

REST API service Dependencies¶

async src.utils.dependencies.get_current_user(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer))¶

Retrieves the current user from the database based on the provided JWT token.

This function decodes the provided JWT token, extracts the email of the user (subject) from the payload, and queries the database to find a user with that email. If the token is invalid or the user cannot be found, an HTTP 401 Unauthorized error is raised.

param db:

The database session used to query for the user.

type db:

AsyncSession

param token:

The JWT token containing the user’s credentials.

type token:

str

return:

The user object if the credentials are valid and the user is found.

rtype:

User

raises HTTPException:

If the credentials are invalid, or if the user cannot be found in the database.

raises JWTError:

If decoding the JWT token fails.
